Context:
Program Name: International Business Management
Code: B411
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 8 months (2 semesters)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,317.00
International Tuition: $18,305.00
Location: St. James Campus
Program Overview: The International Business Management graduate certificate program prepares students for a career in international business management. Students will learn about various topics related to the global market, including documents and procedures needed to move products and services through a global supply chain, compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements, cultural etiquette and business protocols, ethical standards, legal practices, international payment instruments, and foreign exchange strategies. Graduates may work as export control analysts, logistic coordinators, junior import coordinators, or customs raters.
Skills gained: Evaluating the impact of world issues on an organization's global operation.
Programs related: Project Management (Postgraduate) (B415), Human Resources Management (Postgraduate) (B408), Financial Planning (Postgraduate) (B407)

* Domestic tuition is for Canadian students.
** International tuition is for students from other countries.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/International Business Management Program (Postgraduate) B411 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: The Business Management postgraduate program at George Brown College's School of Management focuses on evaluating the impact of world issues on an organization's global business opportunities, conducting market research, creating international marketing plans, and presenting international business plans. Graduates of this program may pursue various careers in international business management, such as export control analyst, junior import coordinator, logistics coordinator, logistics and customs coordinator, and customs rater. The International Business Management graduate certificate also prepares students to pursue additional industry designations/certifications: Certified International Trade Professional (CITP) offered by FITT, Certified Customs Specialist (CCS) offered by the Canadian Society of Customs Brokers, and Certificate in International Freight Forwarding (CIFFA), recognized and approved by the Federation of International Freight Forwarding Associations. However, the requirements for each designation/certification are set by the granting bodies and students need to follow their respective processes and meet all applicable requirements to qualify. George Brown College has partnered with FITT to offer the FITT skills program.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/International Business Management Program (Postgraduate) B411 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: The text provides information about the FITT ( Forum for International Trade Training) college and its B411 program. The B411 program requires the completion of 12 mandatory courses. These courses are spread across two semesters, with 6 courses in each semester. The courses and their respective codes, names, and pre-requisites have been listed. The students need to complete Semester 1 before moving on to Semester 2. Upon graduation, the student will be able to demonstrate various skills related to international business, including conducting environmental scans, market research, managing supply chains, evaluating financial documents, and negotiating effectively in various cultural environments, among others. The learning outcomes of the program have also been outlined.

Context:
Program Information:
- The program involves managing team projects using project management principles.
- Strategies for corporate sustainability, social responsibility, and ethics associated with an organization’s integrative trade initiatives are recommended and their effectiveness evaluated.
- Current technologies are applied to support the organization’s integrative trade initiatives.

Financial Information:
- Domestic Tuition (Fall 2023): $4,317.00
- International Tuition (Fall 2023): $18,305.00
- Domestic Tuition (Fall 2024): Estimated, subject to change
- International Tuition (Fall 2024): Estimated, subject to change
- All fees are subject to change without notice and do not include books which must be purchased separately.

Admission Information:
- A college advanced diploma (three-year), bachelor’s degree, or relevant work experience is required for admission.
- English language proficiency tests are required for international applicants with international transcripts.
- Exemptions may be granted for some college and university credits.
- International students should refer to the International Admissions page for country-specific information.

Miscellaneous:
- The information provided in the website is subject to change without notice.
- Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
- OSAP funding is available for this program, provided applicants meet eligibility criteria.

Context:
The text provides information on how international and domestic students can apply to George Brown College, contact the admissions office and financial aid office, schedule information sessions, and get advice from entry advisors. It also mentions specific programs offered by the Centre for Business, including International Business Management (B411), and provides contact information for the program coordinator, Philip Eng.

Here is the extracted information:

- International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
- Information sessions are held on a regular basis and can be signed up for.
- For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, deadlines, or the admissions process, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section.
- For financial inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section.
- To make an appointment with an Entry Advisor, visit the frequently asked questions page.
- The Centre for Business can be contacted at business@georgebrown.ca or (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160.
- For inquiries related to the International Business Management (B411) program, contact Philip Eng, Program Coordinator, at peng@georgebrown.ca.
- International students can contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry through the International Contact Us page.
